C++ is a powerful programming language that has been widely used in various industries for decades. In a recent interview with Bjarne Stroustrup, the creator of C++, he discusses the importance of safety and security in C++ development.

Stroustrup emphasizes the need for developers to adopt modern C++ features, such as profiles, modules, and concepts, to ensure safer and more secure code. These features provide developers with tools to write code that is easier to understand, maintain, and debug.

Furthermore, Stroustrup shares his insights on upcoming developments in the C++ language. He highlights the importance of continuous improvement and the community's efforts to make C++ more efficient and user-friendly.

For developers looking to stay up to date with the latest news and advancements in the C++ language, this interview provides valuable insights and recommendations from one of the foremost authorities on C++. Whether you are a seasoned C++ developer or just starting out, this article offers a glimpse into the future of C++ and the best practices for writing safe and secure code.
